flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
printed_text: The first piece of ice the Corp rezzes each turn costs 1[credit] more to rez.
stripped_printed_text: The first piece of ice the Corp rezzes each turn costs 1 credit more to rez.

printed_text: +3[mu] Use the MU on Deep Red only for Caïssa programs. Whenever you install a Caïssa program, you may trigger its [click] ability without spending [click]. Limit 1 console per player.
stripped_printed_text: +3 mu Use the MU on Deep Red only for Caissa programs. Whenever you install a Caissa program, you may trigger its click ability without spending click. Limit 1 console per player.

flavor: 'Maneuver warfare' is a doctrine that advocates keeping an enemy off-balance. It works just as well in cyberspace as in reality.
printed_text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break 1 subroutine on host ice. [click]: Host this program on a piece of ice that is not hosting a Caïssa and is not directly inward or outward from this program's current host ice.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break 1 subroutine on host ice. click: Host this program on a piece of ice that is not hosting a Caissa and is not directly inward or outward from this program's current host ice.

printed_text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[credit] as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, where X is the rez cost of that ice.
stripped_printed_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X credits as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, where X is the rez cost of that ice.

flavor: Knowing is half the battle. The easy half, anyway.
printed_text: [click]: Run HQ. If successful, instead of breaching HQ, you may reveal all cards in HQ.
stripped_printed_text: click: Run HQ. If successful, instead of breaching HQ, you may reveal all cards in HQ.

flavor: With modern secretaries, incoming data can be filtered, sorted, tagged, and even sold without the intervention of a human user. In fact, given the zettabytes of data that might flood into a rig on a successful run, a human user could be considered useless ornamentation.
printed_text: When your turn ends, gain 1[credit] if you made a successful run this turn; otherwise, trash Grifter.
stripped_printed_text: When your turn ends, gain 1 credit if you made a successful run this turn; otherwise, trash Grifter.

flavor: The core of the grid. A blinding sphere of light, teeming with energy, crackling with flame. Beyond were only twinkling bits of data in a field of darkness. No hacker dared approach the core, except one. He came back with a flare of code, a torch that burned with the fire of the core itself. The dark places of cyberspace were dark no more, and the legend of g00ru was born.
printed_text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength.

printed_text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D. The Corp may draw that card.
stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D. The Corp may draw that card.

flavor:
"Flint? He's a burnout. A useless, alcoholic waste of Department time and money." -Louis Blaine, NAPD Detective.
"One of the best detectives on my PI list." -Richard Harrison, NAPD Captain.
printed_text: Whenever the Corp takes bad publicity, breach HQ. You cannot access cards in the root of HQ during this breach. [trash]: Expose 1 card.
stripped_printed_text: Whenever the Corp takes bad publicity, breach HQ. You cannot access cards in the root of HQ during this breach. trash: Expose 1 card.

flavor: Even with a virtual ball, it is considered rude not to yell "Fore!"
printed_text: [click]: Add 1 of your installed cards to HQ.
stripped_printed_text: click: Add 1 of your installed cards to HQ.

flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
printed_text: Lose [click]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run. [subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
stripped_printed_text: Lose click: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run. Subroutine The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.

flavor: "I'm getting a reading that is…off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"
printed_text: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.
stripped_printed_text: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.

printed_text: When you score Unorthodox Predictions, choose sentry, code gate or barrier. Subroutines on ice of the chosen type cannot be broken until the beginning of your next turn.
stripped_printed_text: When you score Unorthodox Predictions, choose sentry, code gate or barrier. Subroutines on ice of the chosen type cannot be broken until the beginning of your next turn.

flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
printed_text:
The first time the Runner spends 1 or more [click] during their turn, gain 2[credit]. If those [click] were spent to take an action, the first time during that action a run on this server begins, pay 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
stripped_printed_text: The first time the Runner spends 1 or more click during their turn, gain 2 credits. If those click were spent to take an action, the first time during that action a run on this server begins, pay 2 credits. Errata from CR 1.2

flavor: Who watches the watcher? Probably another camera.
printed_text: When the Runner's turn begins, give the Runner 1 tag unless he or she pays 1[credit].
stripped_printed_text: When the Runner's turn begins, give the Runner 1 tag unless he or she pays 1 credit.

printed_text: When the Runner encounters Snoop, reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Trash 1 of those cards. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.
stripped_printed_text: When the Runner encounters Snoop, reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Trash 1 of those cards. Subroutine Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.

printed_text: Ireress gains "[subroutine] The Runner loses 1[credit]" for each bad publicity you have.
stripped_printed_text: Ireress gains "Subroutine The Runner loses 1 credit" for each bad publicity you have.

printed_text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less.
stripped_printed_text: Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn. Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less.

printed_text:
When the Runner fully breaks this ice, trash it.
[subroutine] End the run.
stripped_printed_text: When the Runner fully breaks this ice, trash it. Subroutine End the run.

flavor: "They're the only labor cheaper than clones."
printed_text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install a non-operation card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
stripped_printed_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Install a non-operation card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
